reviews.text:
Leroy and James, customer assistants, who worked on shift the morning of my accident on the stairs: both need to be commended for their excellent care, compassion and attention to my wellbeing. 

I will describe their actions in the following:

I had an accident on the stairs yesterday in the morning rush to work. 4-5 steps I fell down... Landing ankle first, flexing the foot inward, tearing my left ankle tendon. This is called a level 2-3 sprain. According to my paramedic at St. GEORGE'S A&E. 

Leroy, James and their team immediately took my heavy bags and sat me down to rest the now swollen and disfigured ankle and Leroy talked me into a calm state (5mins). I tried to make it to work and it wasn't happening so a nice man drove me back home from Colliers Wood, where an ambulance took care of me.

Leroy saved my tendon. I commend you sir.
A favorite key stop in my move is very busy, but the service is level. 5 stars for everything.
Great and busy place. The transfer to National Rail Station are very easy and close to the underground.
The staff are a mixed bag, some friendly and some less so. The toilets are almost never open. Trains can disappear from the screens and be assigned to another platform without you being told.
